member.name: T:YeloDebug.LinkStatus
member.summary: Ethernet link status.

member.summary: Ethernet cable is connected and active.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.LinkStatus.Speed100MBPS
member.summary: Ethernet link is set to 100 Mbps.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.LinkStatus.Speed10MBPS
member.summary: Ethernet link is set to 10Mbps.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.LinkStatus.FullDuplex
member.summary: Ethernet link is in full duplex mode.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.LinkStatus.HalfDuplex
member.summary: Ethernet link is in half duplex mode.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.StopOnFlags.CreateThread
member.summary: Suspend title execution when a thread is created.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.StopOnFlags.FCE
member.summary: Suspend title execution when a first-chance exception occurs.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.StopOnFlags.DebugStr
member.summary: Suspend title execution when a string is sent to debug out.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.BreakpointType.None
member.summary: Clear this data breakpoint.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.BreakpointType.Write
member.summary: Break if the address is written to.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.BreakpointType.ReadWrite
member.summary: Break if the address is read from or written to.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.BreakpointType.Execute
member.summary: Break if the address is executed.

member.name: T:YeloDebug.BootFlag
member.summary: Xbox boot type.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.BootFlag.Wait
member.summary: When the reboot is complete, the system software will wait 15 seconds before launching the default title. If you call DmGo during this time, the system software will launch the title immediately.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.BootFlag.Warm
member.summary: Perform a "warm" reboot of the console.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.BootFlag.NoDebug
member.summary: Prevent debugging after reboot. The Xbox debug manager will not be loaded on any subsequent warm reboot; a cold boot is required.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.BootFlag.Stop
member.summary: When the reboot is complete, the system software will wait (with no timeout) before launching the default title. Calling DmGo while the system is waiting will launch the title.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.BootFlag.Cold
member.summary: Complete shut-down of the system before rebooting.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.BootFlag.Current
member.summary: Warm reboot to active title.

member.summary: Xbox video standard.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.WaitType.None
member.summary: Does not wait.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.WaitType.Partial
member.summary: Waits until some data starts being received.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.WaitType.Full
member.summary: Waits until all data has been received. Use only with continuous flows of data, never file IO.

member.summary: Xbox debug connection.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.Xbox.xdkRegistryPath
member.summary: Registry entry to store the last connection used.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.#ctor
member.summary: Xbox connection.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.QueryXboxConnections
member.summary: Returns a list containing all consoles detected on the network.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox._connect
member.summary: Shared connection function

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Connect
member.summary: Connects to an xbox on the network. If multiple consoles are detected this method will attempt to connect to the last connection used. If that connection or information is unavailable this method will fail.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Connect(System.String)
member.summary: Connects to a specified xbox using the box name.
member.param: Case insensitive information may either be a debug ip or the name of a specific xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ConnectToIP(System.String)
member.summary: Connects to an xbox using the IP address

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.RegisterNotificationSession(System.Int32)
member.summary: Registers a notification session on the specified port.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Reconnect(System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to re-establish a connection with the currently selected xbox console.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Reconnect
member.summary: Re-establishes a connection with the currently selected xbox console.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ConnectionCheck
member.summary: Checks the connection status between xbox and pc. This function only checks what YeloDebug believes to be the current connection status. For a true status check you will need to ping the xbox regularly.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Ping(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves xbox connection status. Average execution time of 2200 executions per second, or one every half millisecond.
member.param: Time to wait for a response

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Ping
member.summary: Retrieves xbox connection status. Average execution time of 2200 executions per second, or one every half millisecond.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Reboot(YeloDebug.BootFlag)
member.summary: Reboots the xbox with the specified BootFlag.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Reboot
member.summary: Performs a warm reboot on the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.LaunchTitle(System.String)
member.summary: Launches the specified xbox title and attempts to establish a new connection with that title.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetXboxInformation
member.summary: Reads all static xbox information that will remain constant throughout a session.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.FlushSocketBuffer
member.summary: Clear everything from the receive buffer. Call this before you send anything to the xbox to help keep the channel in sync.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.FlushSocketBuffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Clear a specified amount from the receive buffer. If amount in buffer is less than requested size, everything will be cleared.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Wait(YeloDebug.WaitType)
member.summary: Waits for data to be received. During execution this method will enter a spin-wait loop and appear to use 100% cpu when in fact it is just a suspended thread. This is much more efficient than waiting a millisecond since most commands take fractions of a millisecond. It will either resume after the condition is met or throw a timeout exception.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Wait(System.Int32)
member.summary: Waits for a specified amount of data to be received. Use with file IO.
member.param: Amount of data to wait for

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ReceiveSocketLine
member.summary: Receives a line of text from the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ReceiveMultilineResponse
member.summary: Receives multiple lines of text from the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ReceiveNotification
member.summary: Receives a notification if one is present.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ReceiveNotifications
member.summary: Receives any notifications that may be present.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ReceiveStatusResponse
member.summary: Waits for a status response to be received from the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.SendCommand(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Sends a command to the xbox.

member.summary: Sends binary data to the xbox.

member.summary: Sends binary data of specified length to the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ReceiveBinaryData
member.summary: Receives all available binary data sent from the xbox.

member.summary: Receives binary data of specified size sent from the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ReceiveBinaryData(System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Receives binary data of specified size sent from the xbox.

member.summary: Dont use this, higher-level methods are available. Use FileStream instead.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.WriteFilePartial(System.String,System.Int32,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Dont use this, higher-level methods are available. Use FileStream instead.

member.summary: Dont use this, higher-level methods are available. Use GetDriveFreeSpace or GetDriveSize instead.

member.summary: Retrieves files that belong to a given directory.

member.summary: Sets the size of a specified file on the xbox. This method will not zero out any extra bytes that may have been created.

member.summary: Modifies file creation information. If you wish to specify a new file size, use SetFileSize instead.

member.summary: Sets file attributes.

member.summary: Retrieves file size.

member.summary: Xbox memory stream reader.

member.summary: Xbox memory stream writer.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Getmem(System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Dont use this, higher-level methods are available. Use MemoryReader instead.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Setmem(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Dont use this, higher-level methods are available. Use MemoryWriter instead. Writes to xbox memory. Performance of ~10MB/s due to a simple xbdm.dll modification.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetMemoryChecksum(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the checksum of a block of memory on the xbox.
member.param: Memory address on the Xbox console of the first byte of memory in the block. This address must be aligned on an 8-byte boundary, and it cannot point to code.
Number of bytes on which to perform the checksum. This value must be a multiple of 8.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.DumpMemory
member.summary: A complete dump of xbox memory.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetMemory(System.UInt32,System.TypeCode)
member.summary: Retrieves an object from xbox memory.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetMemory(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves data from xbox memory.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetByte(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves byte from xbox memory.

member.summary: Retrieves Int16 from xbox memory.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetUInt16(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves UInt16 from xbox memory.

member.summary: Retrieves Int32 from xbox memory.

member.summary: Retrieves UInt64 from xbox memory.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetSingle(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves Single from xbox memory.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetDouble(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves Double from xbox memory.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetString(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves a string from xbox memory. Will automatically detect ascii or unicode strings of size greater than 1 char and retrieve as ascii. Maximum string size of 512 characters.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetString(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves a string of specified length from xbox memory.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetASCIIString(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves a null-terminated ascii string from xbox memory. Maximum length of 512 characters.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetUnicodeString(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves a null-terminated unicode string from xbox memory. Maximum length of 512 characters.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.IsValidAddress(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the specified address exists in xbox memory.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.IsValidAddressRange(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks for a valid address range.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.SetMemory(System.UInt32,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes object(s) to a specified xbox memory location.
member.param: Data to write. Specify multiple data instances whenever you have multiple contiguous writes since this function will combine multiple data internally and then send all at once.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.StopOn(YeloDebug.StopOnFlags)
member.summary: Some debugging events require title execution to be suspended. But there are some debugging events where thread suspension is an option. For these events, you can elect to have the debugging subsystem suspend title execution by calling this function.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ClearAllBreakpoints
member.summary: Removes all breakpoints in an xbox title.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.SetBreakPoint(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,YeloDebug.BreakpointType)
member.summary: Sets a hardware breakpoint that suspends title execution when a particular section of memory is referenced.
member.param: Address of the memory to watch.
The size, in bytes, of the memory to be watched. The only allowable values for this parameter are 1, 2, and 4.
Type of access to watch for.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.SetBreakPoint(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets a breakpoint in an xbox title.
member.param: Address where you would like to set a breakpoint.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.RemoveBreakPoint(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Removes a breakpoint in an xbox title.
member.param: Address where you would like to remove a breakpoint.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.HaltThread(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sends a request to the xbox that the specified thread break as soon as possible.
member.param: ID of the thread to be halted. Send 0 as the thread ID to have the debugging subsystem select a thread to break into.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ContinueThread(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Resumes the execution of an xbox thread that has been stopped.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ContinueAllThreads
member.summary: Resumes the execution of all xbox threads that have been stopped.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.SuspendThread(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Suspends a given xbox thread.
member.param: ID of the thread to suspend.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ResumeThread(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Resumes a given xbox thread.
member.param: ID of the thread to resume.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.IsThreadStopped(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified thread is stopped.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetThreadStopInfo(System.UInt32)
member.summary: If the specified thread is stopped this will return information about the circumstances that forced the thread to stop.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Pause
member.summary: Suspends all xbox title threads.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Continue
member.summary: Resumes all xbox title threads.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.SynchronizeTime
member.summary: Synchronizes the xbox system time with the computer's current time.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.RawFramebufferDump(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this if the Screenshot function doesnt dump properly and you wish to add a new format. Framebuffer will be in a swizzled format.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Screenshot
member.summary: Takes a screenshot of the xbox display.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.StreamTest
member.summary: Benchmark utility function best when ran with xdk dash. Lower memory situations will yeild lower speeds.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.CyclePower
member.summary: Shuts down the xbox console and then turns it on again.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Reset
member.summary: Resets the xbox console.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.Shutdown
member.summary: Shuts down the xbox console.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.DisableDVDEjectReset
member.summary: Disables reset on DVD tray eject.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.EnableDVDEjectReset
member.summary: Enables reset on DVD tray eject.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.EjectTray
member.summary: Ejects xbox tray.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.LoadTray
member.summary: Loads xbox tray.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.SetLEDState(YeloDebug.LEDState,YeloDebug.LEDState,YeloDebug.LEDState,YeloDebug.LEDState)
member.summary: Sets the xbox LED state.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.RestoreDefaultLEDState
member.summary: Restores the xbox LED to its default state.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetVideoFlags
member.summary: Gets the xbox video flags.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetVideoStandard
member.summary: Gets the xbox video standard.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ReadEEPROM
member.summary: Reads the xbox EEPROM.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ChangeScriptBufferSize(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Changes the script buffer size.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.CallAddress(System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Simple function call with optional return value. Average execution time of 1.3 ms without return or 1.75ms with return.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.CallAddressEx(System.UInt32,YeloDebug.CPUContext,System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary: Extended function call with optional context, arguments, and return value. Average execution time of 1.3ms without return or 1.75ms with return.
member.param: Cpu context. This parameter may be null.
Arguments to be pushed before the call is made. These are optional of course.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.Xbox.AllocationTable
member.summary: Keeps track of all the memory YeloDebug uses.

member.name: F:YeloDebug.Xbox.BlockAllocationTableSync
member.summary: Prevents YeloDebug from syncing its allocation table with the xbox. This is usefull if you are confident that you wont lose your connection, then you can unblock when you wish to manually sync again. Otherwise, YeloDebug will sync after each memory allocation or release.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.LoadAllocationTable
member.summary: Reads the allocation table from the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.SyncAllocationTable
member.summary: Syncs the allocation table with the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.RemoveAllocationEntry(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Removes an entry from the allocation table.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AssertAllocationExists(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Makes sure the given allocation exists.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AssertAllocationNonexistant(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Makes sure the given allocation does not exist.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetAllocationType(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Determines a given allocations type.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AllocateMemory(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Allocates memory on the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AllocateMemory(YeloDebug.AllocationType,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Allocates memory of specified type on the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.FreeMemory(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Frees xbox memory.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.FreeAllMemory
member.summary: Frees all memory associated with the current allocation table.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.IsEnoughMemory(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Determines if the requested size of memory can be allocated. This function will also borrow from the file cache to meet the requested size if needed.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AlignmentCheck(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Makes sure size is aligned to specs. Unaligned sizes will be rounded up to the next 4kb page boundary.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AllocateDebugMemory(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Allocates debug memory on the xbox. Address space of 0xB0000000 to 0xC0000000.
member.param: Size of memory to be allocated. Note that an unaligned size will be rounded up to the next 4kb page boundary.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.FreeDebugMemory(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Frees debug memory on the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AllocatePhysicalMemory(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Allocates physical memory on the xbox. Address space of 0x80000000 to 0x84000000. Extends to 0x88000000 on a developer kit.
member.param: Size of memory to be allocated. Note that an unaligned size will be rounded up to the next 4kb page boundary.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AllocatePhysicalMemoryEx(System.UInt32,YeloDebug.AddressRange)
member.summary: Allocates physical memory on the xbox. Input range of 0x0 - 0x4000000. Xbox address space of 0x80000000 to 0x84000000. Extends to 0x88000000 on a developer kit.
member.param: Size of memory to be allocated. Note that an unaligned size will be rounded up to the next 4kb page boundary.
Range of memory to place allocation.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.FreePhysicalMemory(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Frees physical memory on the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AllocateVirtualMemory(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Allocates virtual memory on the xbox. Address space of 0x00000000 to 0x80000000.
member.param: Size of memory to be allocated. Note that an unaligned size will be rounded up to the next 4kb page boundary.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AllocateVirtualMemoryEx(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Allocates virtual memory on the xbox. Address space of 0x00000000 to 0x80000000.
member.param: Size of memory to be allocated. Note that an unaligned size will be rounded up to the next 4kb page boundary.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.FreeVirtualMemory(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Frees virtual memory on the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AllocateSystemMemory(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Allocates system memory on the xbox. Address space of 0xD0000000 to 0xFFFFFFFC.
member.param: Size of memory to be allocated. Note that an unaligned size will be rounded up to the next 4kb page boundary.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.FreeSystemMemory(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Frees system memory on the xbox.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.GetFileCacheSize
member.summary: Retrieves the file cache size associated with the current title.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.SetFileCacheSize(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Allows us to borrow extra memory from the file cache :)

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.InitializeHistory
member.summary: Initializes the history page.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.AllocateHistoryPages(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Use in beginning when setting up our history page, since calladdressex will depend on that memory

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.XInputGetStateAddress
member.summary: Searches xbox memory for XInputGetState(). Average execution time of 15ms.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.StateChanged(YeloDebug.InputState,YeloDebug.InputState)
member.summary: Compares the differences between two states and determines if they have changed.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.IsGamepadHooked
member.summary: Detects whether or not we have already hooked into XInputGetState().

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.InitializeControllerHook
member.summary: Hooks into the XInputGetState procedure on your xbox, and hijacks controller input.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.ManuallyInitializeControllerHook(System.UInt32)
member.summary: This is to be used if YeloDebug cannot automatically detect the XInputGetState function address. Then you will need to specify your own if you wish to hook into the controllers. This function has not been tested since I have not found a game which doesn't use the standard XInputGetState function.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.OverrideControllers(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies if the xbox should override controller input and start listening for pc input.

member.name: M:YeloDebug.Xbox.SetGamepadState(System.UInt32,YeloDebug.InputState)
member.summary: Sends gamepad input to a specified controller port. A controller must be plugged into the port for this to work. You are also responsible for the polling frequency.

member.name: P:YeloDebug.Xbox.Connection
member.summary: Gets the main connection used for pc to xbox communication.

member.summary: Gets the xbox kernel information.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum waiting time given (in milliseconds) for a response.

member.name: P:YeloDebug.Xbox.Connected
member.summary: Gets the current connection status known to YeloDebug. For an actual status update you need to Ping() the xbox.

member.name: T:YeloDebug.Exceptions.ApiException
member.summary: Thrown when an YeloDebug API function fails

member.name: T:YeloDebug.Exceptions.NoConnectionException
member.summary: Represents errors that occur when there is no debug connection detected between the xbox and pc.

member.name: T:YeloDebug.Exceptions.ScriptTimeoutException
member.summary: Represents errors that occur when a script becomes unresponsive.

member.name: T:YeloDebug.Exceptions.XboxDebugException
member.summary: Represents errors that occur within the xbox debugging interface.

member.name: T:YeloDebug.Exceptions.UnsupportedException
member.summary: Represents errors that occur when an unsupported method is called.

member.name: T:YeloDebug.Exceptions.MemoryAllocationException
member.summary: Represents errors that occur when an xbox memory allocation fails.

member.name: T:YeloDebug.Exceptions.HistoryCorruptionException
member.summary: Represents errors that occur when a corruption is detected in our history pages.
